intro: Argyreia maymyo, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Philippines, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces fruit that contains a single, large, hard seed. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has cultural significance in various indigenous communities. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is typically found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
